#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Respect

#Text=Thais are a polite people and , while remarkably tolerant of foreigners gallivanting on their beaches and with their women , you ll find that you will get more respect if you in turn treat them and their customs with respect .
#Text=The wai
#Text=Ronald McDonald showing how it 's done

#Text=The traditional greeting known as the wai , where you press your hands together as is in prayer and bow slightly , is derived from the Hindu cultural influence from India , and still widely practised .
#Text=Among Thais , there are strict rules of hierarchy that dictate how and when the wai should be given .
#Text=In brief , inferiors salute superiors first .
#Text=You should not wai service people or street vendors .
#Text=The higher your hands go , the more respectful you are .
#Text=You will also often see Thais doing a wai as they walk past temples and spirit houses .
#Text=As a foreign visitor , you are not expected to know how to wai , nor to reciprocate when wai'd to ;
#Text=while you 're unlikely to cause offense if you do , you may well look slightly strange .
#Text=If somebody makes a wai to you , a slight bow alone is more than sufficient for ordinary occasions , and for business , most Thais will shake hands with foreigners instead of waiing anyway .
#Text=Dress
#Text=Personal appearance is very important in Thailand as a measure of respect to other people .
#Text=You will find that dressing appropriately means that you are shown more respect in return .
#Text=This translates in many ways , even sometimes lowering initial offering prices at markets .
#Text=While some allowance is made for the differing customs of foreigners , Thais respond more positively to well - dressed Westerners .
#Text=Traditionally , Thais are modest and conservative dressers .
#Text=At a minimum your clothes should be neat , clean , and free from holes or tears .
#Text=Except at the beach or at sacred sites normal western dress is acceptable for both men and women , except that you should avoid clothing showing a lot of skin .
#Text=Pants are preferable to shorts , blouses should have capped sleeves , and if tank tops are worn , the straps should be thick ( i.e. , not spaghetti straps ) .
#Text=Thai men generally wear pants , and most Thais view an adult man wearing shorts as fairly ridiculous ;
#Text=shorts are primarily worn by laborers and schoolchildren .
#Text=Men 's shorts should be knee length or more , if worn at all .
#Text=Taking off one 's shoes at temples and private homes is mandatory etiquette , and this may even be requested at some shops .
#Text=Wear shoes that slip on and off easily .
#Text=Flip - flops , hiking sandals , and clog - type shoes are usually a good pragmatic choice for traveling in Thailand ;
#Text=only in the most top - end establishments are shoes required .
#Text=It is best to play it safe with wats and other sacred sites in Thailand ;
#Text=your dress should be unambiguously modest and cover your entire torso and most of your limbs .
#Text=For men , ankle - length pants are mandatory ;
#Text=on top , t - shirts are acceptable , though a button - front or polo shirt would be best .
#Text=Many recommend that women wear only full length dresses and skirts ;
#Text=you should make sure that your clothing covers at least your shoulders and your knees and some places may require that you wear ankle - length pants or skirts and long sleeved tops .
#Text=Shorts and sleeveless shirts are highly inappropriate , as are short skirts .
#Text=The rules are even more strict for foreign visitors , so even if you see a local in shorts it 's not OK for everyone .
#Text=Topless sunbathing is common by Western women at many tourist beaches .
#Text=At beaches which are primarily Thai visitors however , this is not advised .
#Text=Religion
#Text=Buddhist prayer flags , Wat Arun , Bangkok
#Text=Monks are an integral part of Buddhism in Thailand , and Thai men are generally expected to spend a certain amount of time living as a monk at least once in their lifetime .
#Text=Buddhist monks are meant to avoid sexual temptations , and in particular they do not touch women or take things from women 's hands .
#Text=Women should make every effort to make way for monks on the street and give them room so they do not have to make contact with you .
#Text=Women should avoid offering anything to a monk with their hands .
#Text=Objects or donations should be placed in front of a monk so he can pick it up , or place it on a special cloth he carries with him .
#Text=Monks will sometimes be aided by a layman who will accept things from women merit - makers on their behalf .

#Text=Theravada Buddhist monks are also supposed to avoid material temptations and as such , are not allowed to touch money , so offering money to a monk is considered to be a sign of disrespect in most Theravada Buddhist cultures .
#Text=Therefore , should you wish to donate to a monk , you should only offer food , and put your monetary donation in the appropriate donation box at the temple .
#Text=Those monks that accept money are almost always fakes .

#Text=Visit Sydfynske hav to learn about the country 's unique biological features . Visit the South Funen Archipelago , where people migrate to the north .
